item.title: Susan add a quote by Wisława Szymborska
item.description:
"When I pronounce the word Future, the first syllable already belongs to the past.
When I pronounce the word Silence, I destroy it." -- Wisława Szymborska

item.title: Susan add a quote by E. B. White
item.description: "I arise in the morning torn between a desire to improve (or save) the world and a desire to enjoy (or savor) the world. This makes it hard to plan the day." -- E. B. White

item.title: Susan add a quote by Sophocles
item.description: "Fortune is not on the side of the faint-hearted." -- Sophocles

item.title: Susan add a quote by Leo Tolstoy
item.description: "If you look for perfection, you'll never be content." -- Leo Tolstoy

item.title: Susan add a quote by Leo Tolstoy
item.description: "All happy families are alike; each unhappy family is unhappy in its own way." -- Leo Tolstoy

item.title: Susan add a quote by Diane Duane
item.description: "Reading one book is like eating one potato chip." -- Diane Duane

item.title: Susan add a quote by Terry McMillan
item.description: "Too many of us are hung up on what we don't have, can't have, or won't ever have. We spend too much energy being down, when we could use that same energy – if not less of it – doing, or at least trying to do, some of the things we really want to do." -- Terry McMillan

item.title: Susan add a quote by Zig Ziglar
item.description: "Of course motivation is not permanent. But then, neither is bathing; but it is something you should do on a regular basis." -- Zig Ziglar

item.title: Susan add a quote by Abraham Maslow
item.description: "To the man who only has a hammer, everything he encounters begins to look like a nail." -- Abraham Maslow

item.title: Susan add a quote by Fyodor Dostoevsky
item.description: "Talking nonsense is the sole privilege mankind possesses over the other organisms. It's by talking nonsense that one gets to the truth! I talk nonsense, therefore I'm human" -- Fyodor Dostoevsky

item.title: Susan add a quote by Dale Carnegie
item.description: "It isn't what you have or who you are or where you are or what you are doing that makes you happy or unhappy. It is what you think about it." -- Dale Carnegie

item.title: Susan add a quote by Stephen Fry
item.description: "Books are no more threatened by Kindle than stairs by elevators." -- Stephen Fry

item.title: Susan add a quote by Stephen Fry
item.description: "You are who you are when nobody's watching." -- Stephen Fry

item.title: Susan add a quote by Stephen Fry
item.description: "An original idea. That can't be too hard. The library must be full of them." -- Stephen Fry

item.title: Susan add a quote by Arthur C. Clarke
item.description: "Two possibilities exist: either we are alone in the Universe or we are not. Both are equally terrifying." -- Arthur C. Clarke

item.title: Susan add a quote by Philip K. Dick
item.description: "It is sometimes an appropriate response to reality to go insane." -- Philip K. Dick

item.title: Susan add a quote by Douglas Coupland
item.description: "Remember: the time you feel lonely is the time you most need to be by yourself. Life's cruelest irony." -- Douglas Coupland

item.title: Susan add a quote by Umberto Eco
item.description: "Books are not made to be believed, but to be subjected to inquiry. When we consider a book, we mustn't ask ourselves what it says but what it means..." -- Umberto Eco

item.title: Susan add a quote by Baltasar Gracian
item.description: "Never open the door to a lesser evil, for other and greater ones invariably slink in after it." -- Baltasar Gracian

item.title: Susan add a quote by Carl Sandburg
item.description: "Time is the coin of your life. You spend it. Do not allow others to spend it for you." -- Carl Sandburg

item.title: Susan add a quote by Susan Sontag
item.description: "My library is an archive of longings." -- Susan Sontag

item.title: Susan add a quote by John Green
item.description: "As he read, I fell in love the way you fall asleep: slowly, and then all at once." -- John Green

item.title: Susan add a quote by Martin Luther King Jr.
item.description: "There comes a time when one must take a position that is neither safe, nor politic, nor popular, but he must take it because conscience tells him it is right." -- Martin Luther King Jr.

item.title: Susan add a quote by Victoria Holt
item.description: "Never regret. If it's good, it's wonderful. If it's bad, it's experience." -- Victoria Holt

item.title: Susan add a quote by Walter Mosley
item.description: "A peasant that reads is a prince in waiting." -- Walter Mosley

item.title: Susan add a quote by Lisa Mangum
item.description: "You can always choose to change your future." -- Lisa Mangum

item.title: Susan add a quote by Victor Hugo
item.description: "He never went out without a book under his arm, and he often came back with two." -- Victor Hugo

item.title: Susan add a quote by Halldór Laxness
item.description: "For man is essentially alone, and one should pity him and love him and grieve with him." -- Halldór Laxness

item.title: Susan add a quote by John Boyne
item.description: "There's things that happen in a person's life that are so scorched in the memory and burned into the heart that there's no forgetting them." -- John Boyne

item.title: Susan add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "I've been making a list of the things they don't teach you at school. They don't teach you how to love somebody. They don't teach you how to be famous. They don't teach you how to be rich or how to be poor. They don't teach you how to walk away from someone you don't love any longer. They don't teach you how to know what's going on in someone else's mind. They don't teach you what to say to someone who's dying. They don't teach you anything worth knowing." -- Neil Gaiman
